alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Harmon; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:58AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Washita, southern Roger Mills, western Custer, northwestern Kiowa, northeastern Harmon, Greer and Beckham Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 458 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cheyenne to 4 miles northwest of Carter to 9 miles northeast of Vinson. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Sayre, Mangum, Cheyenne, Granite, Burns Flat, Sentinel, Hammon, Dill City, Canute, Lone Wolf, Butler, Carter, Foss, Willow, Strong City, Retrop, Delhi, Foss Reservoir, and Moorewood. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 12 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Custer; Harmon; Roger Mills; Washita
